page.title: 13PHILLIP'S VIEW OF HOOK SHOPS
page.content: Hook's shops are very poor for it's size especially as the village is now growing at an incredible rate.Most of them are small-there is only a limited range of goods.Most people travel to Basingstoke,Farnborough,Reading,Fleet or even Hartley Wintney for groceries which is costly in time and petrol. This is even more of a problem if you are old or have not got a car,like my Granny.She buys groceries from the milkman which is very expensive. Stupidly a few years ago International closed (now a bathroom shop)-they'd do well now.We urgently need at least one really big superstore which sells everything including bikes,clothes and toys which would be open every day.I'm sure it would be profitable as most people are fed up with the 21 shops we have now, especially the ones that are antique shops or estate agents.
